summary: people say that one thing they love about KE is that no explanation is ever given for villanelle’s nature, and while agree that...
body: people say that one thing they love about KE is that no explanation is ever given for villanelle’s nature, and while agree that ofc it’s never explicitly stated, i do very much think that she’s not just crazy and murderous for the heck of it. frankly she’s exhibited far to much empathy and emotion throughout series 1 to be labelled a psychopath, and if she’s not a psychopath, then her personality disorder comes from somewhere, and i don’t think it’s a stretch to formulate certain hypotheses. her specific fascination with death, use of sex and relationships as a method of exercising control, violence as a show of personal interest—all of these sound like the manifestations of specific childhood trauma imo

summary: Shows that end with a planned number of seasons are nice because they usually end while the show is still good rather than go on...
body:
Shows that end with a planned number of seasons are nice because they usually end while the show is still good rather than go on forever and get awful. But I hope Killing Eve is planning on having more than three because that’s too short. At least make it four seasons. I know the rumors about it ending at three are stemming from the fact that there’s only going to be three books but didn’t the writers say that they’re going pretty much completely off-base from the books in S2?

Also: Yay at them already getting renewed before the season even starts AGAIN. I stan legends.

tags: a post lurking in my drafts time for a release
summary: So I was thinking about s2 and doing a little Killing Eve rewatch on the side. “Sorry Baby” is actually such a good episode, a...
body:
So I was thinking about s2 and doing a little Killing Eve rewatch on the side. “Sorry Baby” is actually such a good episode, a very underrated one at that too, because one of my absolute favorite things about it is watching Villanelle work in a group with two other people that drive her so high up the wall that she “kills” them both, and then I thought of season two and well. That will be interesting. 

She’s operating at such a disadvantage from the start in 1x04 and constantly needs to remind everyone around her of that vocally. The group literally leeches any enjoyment of the trip out of her, which is hilarious to us since we know how wonderfully manipulative and advanced Villanelle’s usual MO is - always being ten steps ahead - and because it’s so clear how useless Diego and Nadia are compared to Villanelle. Obviously Konstantin knows what he is doing to Villanelle with that, that she will suffer because of the work ethic she is put in. Her self-reliance is so quintessential to her since she is so damn sure about her skillset. She is a first class girl, not someone who wants to rely on others for information and has to spend her night inside a freaking van with a cushion: 

And yet that’s her circumstance, and it’s so fucking funny to see her have to take that step back and seethe beneath that calm demeanour because she waits and waits and waits and waits more until pew pew pew. The way Villanelle packages her job really does keep her sane. These people are a blank slate to her. Like, she isn’t a mascot figure positioned to dispense “awesomeness” without any story of her own (take Diego and his guns for example). If she had done this on her own things would have looked different. She wouldn’t have to have ask this:

Or say this because these idiots don’t get that if you have no idea you lose:

Or when they finally know who their target is but without any preparation:

Neither Diego nor Nadia did their research like Villanelle would’ve.

Konstantin would tell her that’s a big attitude but she’s actually holding that composure (HOW MANY TIMES DOES SHE LOOK LIKE SHE IS GONNA KILL THEM IN THE NEXT HOT SECOND, I COUNTED. YALL WANNA KNOW?).

Villanelle isn’t the target but the cards are stacked so overwhelmingly against her that you can literally Feel the way her impatience wears thin, knowing how important her job is to her, how well she wants to do it and not be deprived of everything. A group slows her down and that gets under her skin. In spite of all this though she doesn’t lose her stubborn and effective streak of practicability.

Or here my favorite:

She is having such a hard time. Like you know she is crying in that picture but only on the inside for like one second because even when she’s stuck with these two she is still miles ahead, which she knows and the ending shows (catches up with Eve hehe). I get why Villanelle didn’t wife Nadia and only kept her around for whatever btw, but “You won’t work alone again”? CACKLES. Villanelle shoots holes into that statement, that’s her whole deal. And that says so much about her, that her reaction isn’t to wrench herself into some semblance of teammatehood but to bend the situation until she is by herself again. Given s2 though, I wonder how it will play out with Eve in the picture. Like, how that closeness, I mean… intimacy will shape them further. Because it will if it hasn’t already because ep four Villanelle doesn’t know about ep eight Villanelle hahah.

For now she’s got her juice back: 

(Not really, the car stops working LMAOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO).

blog.name: chenckino
blog.title: I Feel Things When I Am With You

body: How does it feel?

trail.content_raw: How does it feel?

summary:
It’s oh so quiet
It’s oh so still 
You’re (not) alone
And so peaceful until 
You fall in love
(c) @sckberry on twitter

summary: I’m not interested in how Villanelle came to be a killer. Well, I am. Why? It doesn’t help us.
